📘詳細解釋
氧化劑會抑制根細胞的呼吸作用，使主動運輸減慢，ATP 生成下降。由於根細胞主動吸收礦物鹽需要能量驅動，此過程減弱後，內部溶質濃度降低，水的吸收速率隨之下降。
Oxidizing agents inhibit the respiration of root cells, reducing ATP production. Since active transport of mineral ions requires energy, its slowdown decreases the solute concentration inside the root cells, thus lowering osmotic water uptake.

(B) 錯：氧化劑不僅影響導管，而是令吸收組織細胞失活或死亡。
(B) Incorrect: Oxidizing agents don’t just damage xylem; they inactivate root cells responsible for absorption.

(C) 錯：水分子的擴散屬滲透作用 (osmosis)，不需氧氣，因此此選項未考慮主動吸收的能量需求。
(C) Incorrect: Water’s entry by osmosis is passive and oxygen‑independent, so this option ignores the energy factor.

(D) 錯：氧化抑制會減緩水吸收，但不會令水分逆流流出。
(D) Incorrect: Inhibition reduces uptake but does not cause water to move backwards.

📎考試提醒
留意「氧化抑制呼吸 → ATP 減少 → 主動運輸減緩 → 水吸收速率下降」。
Remember the chain: Oxidation → less ATP → slower active transport → less water uptake.

透析管能讓水通過，但不能讓糖分子通過。最初管內糖溶液的水勢低於外部蒸餾水，因此水由外進入袋內，使袋內液面逐漸上升，最終達平衡時上升趨緩。
A dialysis tube is permeable to water but not to sugar. Initially, its sugar solution has lower water potential than the surrounding distilled water, so water enters, raising the liquid level until equilibrium is reached.

(1) In the chloroplast, light energy is converted into chemical energy to form glucose.

📎考試提醒

During the cardiac cycle, blood leaves the left ventricle when ventricular pressure exceeds aortic pressure, causing the aortic valve to open. This occurs shortly after the QRS complex when ventricular systole begins.

P波代表心房興奮，R波之後心室開始收縮，S波稍後壓力達高峰。
P wave = atrial depolarization; after R, ventricular contraction begins; S represents peak pressure phase.

📎考試提醒

Quick recall: P → QRS → T = Atrium → Ventricle contract → Ventricle relax.

Bicuspid (mitral) and semilunar valves close depending on pressure differences: when ventricular pressure > atrial, the mitral valve closes; when ventricular < aortic, the semilunar valve closes — both occur after QRS.

記：QRS = 收縮期 → 瓣關閉、壓上升。
Tip: QRS = contraction phase → valves close, pressure rises.

📌 詳細解釋：
結構 X 是木質部，而 Y 是韌皮部。
Structure X is the xylem, while Y is the phloem.

Xylem consists of dead cells specialized for transporting water and minerals from roots to other parts of the plant.

韌皮部則為活細胞，能運送由光合作用產生的有機養分（如蔗糖）至植物各部分以供代謝。
Phloem is made of living cells that transport organic nutrients (e.g., sucrose) produced by photosynthesis to various parts for metabolism.

由於木質部的細胞壁加厚并木質化，使細胞結構堅固，提供機械支持，因此能支撐植物直立生長。
Because xylem walls are lignified and thickened, they provide strong mechanical support enabling plants to stay upright.

韌皮部則缺少這種木質化結構，所以主要作用並非支撐。
Phloem lacks such lignification, so it is not primarily a supporting tissue.

📌 為什麼不是其他選項：
A 選項錯在木質部非活組織，並不進行運輸有機物。
Option A is wrong because xylem is not living and cannot transport organic matter.
B 選項弄反兩者的功能，木質部運水，韌皮部運養分。
Option B reverses the roles: xylem transports water, phloem transports food.
C 選項誤認兩者皆為活細胞，但木質部已死亡。
Option C incorrectly assumes both are living, yet xylem cells are dead.

📌 考試提醒：
要分辨植物的「雙輸系統」：木質部運送無機物與水；韌皮部運送有機養分。
Remember the dual transport system in plants: xylem → water/minerals, phloem → organic nutrients.
此外，木質化是支持與防止水分滲漏的關鍵字。
Also, “lignified” is the keyword for support and waterproofing in xylem tissues.
